text: Roy Francis McGillicuddy (August 27, 1888 – February 11, 1960), known as Roy Mack, was an American baseball team owner who co-owned the Philadelphia Athletics of the American League with his brother Earle Mack from through . In 1954, the brothers sold the Athletics to Arnold Johnson, who moved the team to Kansas City, Missouri one season later. Mack was born in Washington, D.C. in 1888,U.S., World War II Draft Registration Cards, 1942 the son of Hall of Fame manager and former Athletics owner Connie Mack and Gertrude Browning Chaffee. His paternal grandparents, Michael McGillicuddy and Mary McKillop, were born in Ireland.1870 United States Federal Census He grew up in Worcester, Massachusetts,1900 United States Federal Census where he attended Worcester Academy. He died in Lower Merion Township, Pennsylvania, aged 71.Pennsylvania, Death Certificates, 1906-1966 ==References== *Oakland Athletics owners Category:1888 births Category:1960 deaths Category:Businesspeople from Worcester, Massachusetts Category:Mack family Category:Major League Baseball owners Category:Philadelphia Athletics executives Category:Philadelphia Athletics owners
title: Roy Mack
